intro: Pseudocyclosorus esquirolii, commonly known as the Esquiroli's false chain fern, is a rare and delicate fern species native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is characterized by its intricate, finely divided fronds that resemble those of true chain ferns. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found on rock surfaces or in dense forest undergrowth. Its small, delicate spores are dispersed by wind, contributing to its limited distribution. Due to habitat destruction, Pseudocyclosorus esquirolii is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
